Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as an exaggeration because it states that Medicare has spent $172 million on penis pumps in the last five years, which is a large amount of money.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide any evidence or sources to support the statement that Medicare has spent $172 million on penis pumps.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Medicare spending on penis pumps is a double-standard compared to the coverage of contraceptives.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for Medicare spending on penis pumps, such as medical necessity or the effectiveness of the treatment for erectile dysfunction.
